-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
> /kind bug


**What happened**:

[root@node-21 EFK]# kubectl logs -f fluentd-es-jrsf7 -n kube-system
/var/lib/gems/2.1.0/gems/ffi-1.9.18/lib/ffi/library.rb:147:in `block in ffi_lib': Could not open library 'libsystemd.so.0': libgcrypt.so.11: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. (LoadError)
Could not open library 'libsystemd.so': libsystemd.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory.
Could not open library 'libsystemd-id128.so.0': libdw.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory.
Could not open library 'libsystemd-id128.so': libsystemd-id128.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

	from /var/lib/gems/2.1.0/gems/fluentd-0.12.39/lib/fluent/plugin.rb:172:in `block in try_load_plugin'

	from /usr/local/bin/fluentd:23:in `<main>'

**What you expected to happen**:
fluentd-es run success
**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
kubectl create -f fluentd-es-ds.yaml

the image is google-containers/fluentd-elasticsearch:v2.0.0


**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"7", GitVersion:"v1.7.2", GitCommit:"922a86cfcd65915a9b2f69f3f193b8907d741d9c", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-21T08:23:22Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):centos 7.3
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):Linux node-21.46 3.10.0-514.26.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 4 15:04:05 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Others:
@crassirostris

title: the fluentd-es cannot start
